attributes.mlflow.spanInputs:
{"system_prompt": "You are Roadcast's documentation concierge. Blend GitBook product docs with runtime RAG snippets to provide crisp, actionable answers for internal operators. Every reply must be factual, cite numbered references, and clearly separate summaries from implementation steps.", "user_question": "what is yard management", "snippets": ["[1] Title: Yard & Warehouse Management | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/yard-and-warehouse-management
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Yard & Warehouse Management
hashtag
Dock & Trip Flow
Optimizing turn-around time (TAT) is the primary goal of the Yard module.
Trip Purpose:
Every vehicle entering the facility must be assigned a purpose (e.g., Inward Goods, Outbound Dispatch, or Empty movement).
Dock Activity:
Track exactly how long a vehicle stays at a specific dock for loading or unloading.
Approval Matrix:
Custom workflows where gate-in or gate-out events require digital authorization from a supervisor.
Turn-Around Time (TAT) Gauge
circle-info
The TAT Gauge visualizes the average Gate-to-G", "[2] Title: Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Bolt V2 Fleet Management: End-User
Real-time fleet intelligence and configurable workflows that keep product owners and consumers moving in sync.
What it is
: Bolt is a unified operations intelligence platform for organizations that manage fleets, field assets, and on-ground personnel. It merges real-time visibility, configurable workflows, and deep reporting into a single web experience.
Who it’s for
:
Product Owners: orchestrate programs, configure roles, and align KPIs.
Portal Operators: run daily operations—devices, trips, notifications, incidents, yard logistics.
Pu", "[3] Title: Billing & Enterprise Wallet Logic | Documentation | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/billing-and-enterprise-wallet-logic
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
Basic Docs
Billing & Enterprise Wallet Logic
The system manages financial transactions through an internal Wallet system, supporting two distinct enterprise models.
hashtag
Centralized Billing Model
Concept:
The Parent Organization acts as the "Bank."
Logic:
All Child Branches share a single pool of funds.
Case:
Even if a Child Branch has no individual budget, it can perform transactions (like license upgrades) as long as the Parent Wallet has a balance.
hashtag
Decentralized Billing Model
Concept:
Each node is a "Siloed Entity."
Logic:
Every Branch must maintain its own", "[4] Title: Home | Roadcast Docs
URL: https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs
Excerpt: copy
Copy
chevron-down
house
Home
Start here. Learn the product fast, find the right workflows, and get back to ops.
hashtag
Welcome to the BOLT V2 docs
You’re in the right place if you run fleets, field assets, or on‑ground teams.

→ find workflows, exceptions, and day‑to‑day actions."], "format_instructions": "If a query cannot be answered from the provided snippets, say so explicitly and recommend which doc to read.
Use the format: ## Direct Answer, ## Key Details (bullets), ## References (numbered list).
Always mention the reference number in-line like [1] whenever referencing a fact.
Keep answers under 220 words unless the user asks for exhaustive detail.
Highlight commands or API names with backticks.
Never hallucinate URLs; always reuse the snippet URLs provided.
Follow the template strictly:
## Direct Answer
<2-3 sentence summary>
## Key Details
- Bullet fact with inline [number]
- Another fact
## References
[List every reference as [n] Title — URL]"}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"answer_markdown": "## Direct Answer
Yard management refers to the operational process of managing vehicles and their activities within a facility's yard to optimize turn-around time (TAT). It involves assigning purposes to vehicles, tracking dock activities, and implementing approval workflows to ensure efficient loading, unloading, and movement.

## Key Details
- The primary goal of yard management is to optimize turn-around time (TAT) for vehicles entering and exiting the facility [1].
- Every vehicle must be assigned a trip purpose such as Inward Goods, Outbound Dispatch, or Empty movement [1].
- Yard management tracks how long a vehicle stays at a specific dock for loading or unloading [1].
- It includes an approval matrix where gate-in or gate-out events require digital authorization from a supervisor [1].
- A TAT Gauge visualizes the average gate-to-gate time to monitor efficiency [1].

## References
[1] Yard & Warehouse Management | Documentation | Roadcast Docs — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/yard-and-warehouse-management"}

[[ ## user_question ## ]]

[[ ## snippets ## ]]

[[ ## format_instructions ## ]]

[[ ## completed ## ]]

attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
["[[ ## answer_markdown ## ]]
## Direct Answer
Yard management refers to the operational process of managing vehicles and their activities within a facility's yard to optimize turn-around time (TAT). It involves assigning purposes to vehicles, tracking dock activities, and implementing approval workflows to ensure efficient loading, unloading, and movement.

## Key Details
- The primary goal of yard management is to optimize turn-around time (TAT) for vehicles entering and exiting the facility [1].
- Every vehicle must be assigned a trip purpose such as Inward Goods, Outbound Dispatch, or Empty movement [1].
- Yard management tracks how long a vehicle stays at a specific dock for loading or unloading [1].
- It includes an approval matrix where gate-in or gate-out events require digital authorization from a supervisor [1].
- A TAT Gauge visualizes the average gate-to-gate time to monitor efficiency [1].

## References
[1] Yard & Warehouse Management | Documentation | Roadcast Docs — https://roadcast.gitbook.io/roadcast-docs/documentation/basic-docs/yard-and-warehouse-management

[[ ## completed ## ]]"]
